CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "set_translations"
(
    id          INTEGER not null
        primary key autoincrement,
    language    TEXT,
    setCode     TEXT
        references sets (code)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
    translation TEXT
);

content.content:
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "sets"
(
    id               INTEGER           not null
        primary key autoincrement,
    baseSetSize      INTEGER,
    block            TEXT,
    booster          TEXT,
    code             TEXT              not null
        unique,
    isFoilOnly       INTEGER default 0 not null,
    isForeignOnly    INTEGER default 0 not null,
    isNonFoilOnly    INTEGER default 0 not null,
    isOnlineOnly     INTEGER default 0 not null,
    isPartialPreview INTEGER default 0 not null,
    keyruneCode      TEXT,
    mcmId            INTEGER,
    mcmIdExtras      INTEGER,
    mcmName          TEXT,
    mtgoCode         TEXT,
    name             TEXT,
    parentCode       TEXT,
    releaseDate      DATE,
    tcgplayerGroupId INTEGER,
    totalSetSize     INTEGER,
    type             TEXT
);

content.text: Now let me check the hint: the claim says "Tenth Edition" but the hint says `name = 'Tenth Edition'`. Let me find the set and count distinct translations.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/card_games.sqlite" "SELECT s.code, s.name FROM sets s WHERE s.name = 'Tenth Edition';"

sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/card_games.sqlite" "SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT st.translation) FROM set_translations st JOIN sets s ON st.setCode = s.code WHERE s.name = 'Tenth Edition' AND st.translation IS NOT NULL;"
input.description: Count distinct translations for Tenth Edition

content.text:
There are 10 total translation rows, but Chinese Simplified and Chinese Traditional share the same translation text "核心系列第十版", so there are only **9 distinct translations**.

The claim states there are 9 distinct translations of the set name "Tenth Edition", which matches exactly.
